content.text: How TO - Redirect to Another Webpage
Learn how to redirect to another webpage using JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to redirect to another webpage using JavaScript.

content.text: There are a couple of ways to redirect to another webpage with JavaScript. The most popular ones are location.href and location.replace :
content.html: There are a couple of ways to redirect to another webpage with JavaScript. The most popular ones are location.href and location.replace:

content.code_html:
// Simulate a mouse click:
window.location.href = "http://www.w3schools.com";

// Simulate an HTTP redirect:
window.location.replace("http://www.w3schools.com");

content.text: Note: The difference between href and replace, is that replace() removes the URL of the current document from the document history, meaning that it is not possible to use the "back" button to navigate back to the original document.
content.html: Note: The difference between href and replace, is that replace() removes the URL of the current document from the document history, meaning that it is not possible to use the "back" button to navigate back to the original document.

content.text: Tip: For more information about the Location Object, read our Location Object Reference .
content.html: Tip: For more information about the Location Object, read our Location Object Reference.
